content:
1. Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart - Considered one of the greatest composers of all time, Mozart was born in Salzburg, Austria. He composed over 600 works in his short life, including operas, symphonies, chamber music, and choral works.

2. Franz Schubert - Born in Vienna in 1797, Schubert is considered one of the most important composers of the early Romantic era. He composed over 600 Lieder, as well as several symphonies, chamber music, and operas.

3. Johann Strauss II - Known as the "Waltz King," Strauss was a composer and conductor who was born in Vienna in 1825. He composed more than 500 works, including over 150 waltzes, as well as polkas, quadrilles, and operettas.

4. Anton Bruckner - Born in Upper Austria in 1824, Bruckner was a composer and organist who is considered one of the most important symphonists of the 19th century. He wrote nine symphonies, as well as several masses, motets, and other sacred works.

5. Arnold Schoenberg - Born in Vienna in 1874, Schoenberg is known for developing the twelve-tone technique, a method of organizing musical notes that became a key component of modernist music. He also wrote several operas, chamber music, and other works.
